fullForm: Common Law Admission Test Post Graduate
eligibility: Candidates must have completed a 3-year LLB or 5-year integrated LLB degree or equivalent from a recognized university. Minimum marks required: 50% for General/OBC/PWD/NRI/PIO/OCI categories and 45% for SC/ST categories.
subjectsTested: Other areas of law such as Jurisprudence, Administrative Law, Law of Contract, Torts, Family Law, Criminal Law, Property Law, Company Law, Public International Law, Tax Law, Environmental Law, and Labour & Industrial Law
negativeMarking: 0.25 marks deducted for each incorrect answer

faqs.question: What is the mode of the CLAT PG exam?
faqs.answer: The CLAT PG exam is conducted in offline mode as a pen-and-paper based test.
